Issues.Title: Fix filepath casing
Issues.Body:
Contributes to dotnet/wpf#6725

## Description
Renames files and directories that do not match the path in the project files or that multiple projects references the same file with different casing.

## Customer Impact
Should fix issues with Source Link (Like dotnet/wpf#6725).

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + CI.

## Risk
Low.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/6762)

Issues.Title: ListBox.ScrollIntoView with grouping
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version: .NET 6.0

- Windows version: 10

- Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

**Problem description:**
`ListBox.ScrollIntoView` doesn't work with grouped collectionview.

**Actual behavior:**
Nothing happens

**Expected behavior:**
`ListBox` scrolls to object passed into `ScrollIntoView`
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[ScrollIntoViewMinRepro.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9054956/ScrollIntoViewMinRepro.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListBox.ScrollIntoView with grouping" (#6760)

Issues.Title: Auto Width of TextBox doesn't fill Horizontal StackPanel correctly
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET 6.0
* Windows version: 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
 
 **Problem description:**
If you create a StackPanel, with horizontal orientation, and put a textbox within it (with the default auto width) the textbox doesn't fill the Stackpanel, it defaults to a width of 6. With vertical orientation, the textbox fills the whole width.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
TextBox Auto Width is too small inside horizontal oriented StackPanel 

 **Expected behavior:**
TextBox Auto Width should fill the whole stack panel when using Auto width.
 
![example screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31216671/177528983-b584acea-5d6c-4c28-b706-6df2c2399ce0.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Auto Width of TextBox doesn't fill Horizontal StackPanel correctly" (#6759)

Issues.Title: ScrollViewer (apparently) resets child Grid ColumnDefinition's to *
Issues.Body:
Hello,

See the following:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7372902/177523900-f7032653-3a7e-49d4-b296-2be6205586f0.png)
```xaml
<Grid Width="200" Height="200">
    <ScrollViewer VerticalScrollBarVisibility="Auto" HorizontalScrollBarVisibility="Auto">
        <Grid Background="Green">
            <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="50"/>
                <ColumnDefinition Width="*"/>
            </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <Rectangle Fill="Red" Margin="5" Grid.Column="0"/>
            <Rectangle Fill="Blue" Margin="5" Grid.Column="1"/>
            <Rectangle Fill="Violet" Opacity="0.7" Grid.Column="0" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Width="40" HorizontalAlignment="Left"/>
        </Grid>
    </ScrollViewer>
</Grid>

```

Inside a 200x200 Grid we have a ScrollViewer, which hosts a Grid where Rectangles are occupying their respective Columns.
A third Rectangle overflows through both defined Columns, the above XAML is fine, no issue so far.

However the moment I set the Width of the third Rectangle to a size greater than what the Grid hosting the ScrollViewer supports, for example 400, the ColumnDefinitions behave as if I had set both to "*", which is incorrect, it should show the Horizontal ScrollBar, make the Grid that is inside the ScrollViewer bigger where only the Column Index 1 inscreases in Width, while 0 remains with 50px Width.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7372902/177524341-36c50bae-fd3f-480b-86c5-49fa773945c3.png)

Seemingly in VS2019 it still shows in the Designer that 50 and 1* are attributed, but the behavior is as if both were 1*.
This happens in both the Designer and while running the application.

Is this a bug or is my assumption incorrect and it's behaving as intended?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ScrollViewer (apparently) resets child Grid ColumnDefinition's to *" (#6758)

Issues.Title: Window.Close() does not close owned windows
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 6.0
* Windows version: 20H2
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Window.Close() closes non-owned windows as documented.

See:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.window.close?view=windowsdesktop-6.0
_Closing a Window causes any windows that it owns to be closed_
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

- ShowDialog() not returns on Close().
- ShowDialog() returns on MainWindow close.

 
 **Expected behavior:**

- Owned windows are closed as documented.
- ShowDialog() returns.

 
 **Minimal repro:**
[WindowCloseBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9053163/WindowCloseBug.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Window.Close() does not close owned windows" (#6757)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/winforms" (#6740)

Issues.Title: Remote Deskop Disconnect/Reconnect Issues
Issues.Body:
* Windows version: Windows10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
 
 **Problem description:**

Not sure if question/defect.

I've done alot of googling found some responses, but nothing that ultimately helps.

When reconnecting to a remote desktop session we are seeing the following.

* Controls being unloaded then reloaded
* Controls within DataTemplates being completed re-created

Is there anyway to prevent this from happening ?

We have ported a very large Silverlight application to WPF and this is biting us pretty hard.

In some cases we been able to refactor some logic to reduce the number of usages of loaded/unloaded events.

But we also have alot of Behaviors, Converters, etc breaking within a DataTemplate.

We making very slow progress here, and hoping to find a more of a global solution to prevent this from occurring.

If you can please assist.

Many thanks
 
 **Minimal repro:**

With the below reconnect to disconnected remote desktop session.

Notice the Unloaded then Loaded callback hits.
Notice the hashcode for the TextBlock has changed.

```xml
     <Grid.Resources>
            <local:HashCodeConverter x:Key="hashcodeconverter" />
            <DataTemplate x:Key="datatemplate">
                <TextBlock x:Name="txtblock"
                           Text="{Binding ElementName=txtblock, Converter={StaticResource hashcodeconverter}}" />
            </DataTemplate>
        </Grid.Resources>

        <StackPanel>
            <ContentControl ContentTemplate="{StaticResource datatemplate}" />
            <Button Loaded="Button_Loaded"
                    Unloaded="Button_UNLoaded">Test</Button>
        </StackPanel>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remote Deskop Disconnect/Reconnect Issues" (#6739)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_CustomComboBox_MainWindow_movieSelected_ScreenReader: The screen reader is not announcing the selected movie when the focus is on "Watch Now".
Issues.Body:
[6738.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9008587/6738.zip)
“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags**:#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG4.1.2;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Narrator;#NVDA;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Sample Applications and right click on the  Custom Combo box  and click on build.
3. Then right click on Custom Combo box then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. Main Window screen should open.
5. Navigate to accordion and select any movie by clicking the button present to watch now.
6. Turn on the screen reader and observe the announcement.

### Actual:
The screen reader is not announcing the selected movie when the focus is on "Watch Now".

### Expected:
The screen reader should announce the selected movie when the focus is on "Watch Now".

### User Impact:
Screen reader users wont know which movie is selected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_CustomComboBox_MainWindow_movieSelected_ScreenReader: The screen reader is not announcing the selected movie when the focus is on "Watch Now"." (#6738)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Keyboard: The table column headers are not accessible by keyboard.
Issues.Body:
“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags:**#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG2.1.1;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Keyboard;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Getting started and right click on the Expense it intro and click on build
3. Then right click on Expense it Intro then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. Navigate to Names list and select any name and click on View.
5. 'Expense Report for' screen will open
6. Tab till table and observe the issue

### Actual:
The table column headers "ExpenseType" and "Amount" are not accessible by keyboard. While using mouse and clicking on this column headers sorting functionality is performed but we are not able to use sorting functionality by using keyboard.

### Expected:
The table column headers "ExpenseType" and "Amount" should be accessible by keyboard. So that the sorting functionality should be accessible by using keyboard.

### User Impact:
Keyboard users will not be able to sort the data by using keyboard.
[WPF keyboard.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9008397/WPF.keyboard.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Keyboard: The table column headers are not accessible by keyboard." (#6737)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ViewExpenseReport_Contrast: The color contrast for "Names" list item is less than 4.5:1.
Issues.Body:
“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags**:#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG1.4.3;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#ColorContrast;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Getting started and right click on the Expense it intro and click on build
3. Then right click on Expense it Intro then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. Verify all the elements of 'View Expense Report' 
5. Turn on Color contrast analyzer and check that The Color contrast ratio for "Names" list item is less than 4.5:1.

### Actual:

The color contrast for "Names" list item is less than 4.5:1.

**Similar issue observed in the below scenario:**
**Issue: ExpenseItIntro - Expense Report for**

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Getting started and right click on the Expense it intro and click on build
3. Then right click on Expense it Intro then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. Navigate to Names list and select any name and click on View.
5. Verify all the elements of 'Expense Report for' screen 
6. Turn on Color contrast analyzer and check that The Color contrast ratio for "ExpenseType" and "Amount" and " is less than 4.5:1.

### Expected:
The color contrast for "Names" list item should be more than or equal to 4.5:1.

### User Impact:
Low vision users won't be able to see the list item.

![Screenshot (1160)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86710888/176378794-a89da405-9171-4c64-a297-d7ff64f50cbe.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ViewExpenseReport_Contrast: The color contrast for "Names" list item is less than 4.5:1." (#6736)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Usability: Screen reader is announcing the table data twice when it received focus.
Issues.Body:
“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags:**#A11yUsable;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev4;#NVDA;#Narrator;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2022 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Getting started and right click on the Expense it intro and click on build
3. Then right click on Expense it Intro then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. Navigate to Names list and select any name and click on View.
5. Tab to "View" button.
6. 'Expense Report for' screen will open tab till Table and 
7. Turn on the screen reader and observe the announcement.

### Actual:
Screen reader is announcing the table data twice when it received focus.

**This issue does not observe with Narrator**

### Expected:
Screen reader should not unnecessarily announce the table data twice when it received focus. It should only announce it once.

### User Impact:
Screen reader Users will get confused because of twice announcements.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86710888/176373458-e84be31e-563a-405f-a74c-d28c7b3ee570.mp4


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86710888/176373487-e6873536-16c5-49d3-b47c-d02203c1d78f.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Usability: Screen reader is announcing the table data twice when it received focus." (#6735)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ListofProducts_AddProductListing_Zoom: The "Add Product" Button is not visible at 200% zoom.
Issues.Body:
![6734](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86710491/176371946-3c28208b-630a-4c5a-823f-8710eaa7d916.png)


“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags**:#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG1.4.4;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Zoom;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Sample Applications and right-click on the DatabindingDemo and click on build.
3. Then right click on DatabindingDemo then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. List of products screen should open.
5.Navigate to Add product button and click on it.
6. Zoom the screen to 200% and observe that The "Add Product" Button is not visible at 200% zoom

### Actual:
The "Add Product" Button is not visible at 200% zoom.

### Expected:
The "Add Product" Button should be visible at 200% zoom.

### User Impact:
Low vision users won't be able to see the add product button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ListofProducts_AddProductListing_Zoom: The "Add Product" Button is not visible at 200% zoom." (#6734)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ListofProducts_GroupByCategory_ScreenReader: Screen reader is unnecessarily announcing list items for sale after checking / unchecking the checkbox.
Issues.Body:
[6733.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/9007569/6733.zip)

### Actual:
Screen reader is unnecessarily announcing list items for sale after checking / unchecking the checkbox.

**This issue is also observed with the screen reader Narrator.**

**_This issue is observed with all the checkboxes present o this screen._**

### Expected:
Screen reader should not  unnecessarily announce list items for sale after checking / unchecking the checkbox. It should announce the results.


“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags**:#A11yMAS;##A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG1.3.1;#Element:Checkbox;#NVDA;#Narrator;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#ColorContrast;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Sample Applications and right click on the DatabindingDemo and click on build.
3. Then right click on DatabindingDemo then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. List of products screen should open.
5. Select Group by category check box.
6. Turn on the screen reader and observe the announcement.

### User Impact:
Screenreader Users will receive incorrect indications because of unnecessary content announcements.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ListofProducts_GroupByCategory_ScreenReader: Screen reader is unnecessarily announcing list items for sale after checking / unchecking the checkbox." (#6733)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_DatabindingDemo_ListofProducts_NonTextContrast: The color contrast of the selected list item is less than 3:1.
Issues.Body:
![6732_A11y_ NET Core_WPF_DatabindingDemo_ListofProducts_NonTextContrast](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86710491/176358072-35ab3d7c-b6c1-44b5-810c-344b6af4dfbc.png)


“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

**GitHubTags**:#A11yMAS;#A11yWCAG2.1;#A11yTCS;#.NET Core[WPF]-Win32-June2022;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG1.4.11;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#ColorContrast;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
.NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS 2019 Int Preview
2. Navigate to Sample Applications and right click on the DatabindingDemo and click on build.
3. Then right click on DatabindingDemo then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance. 
4. List of products screen should open.
5. Verify all the elements of 'DatabindingDemo_List of Products' screen are accessible and MAS Compliant
6. Turn on Color contrast analyzer and check that The Color contrast ratio of the selected list item is less than 3:1.

### Actual:
The color contrast of the selected list item is less than 3:1.

### Expected:
The color contrast of the selected list item should be more than or equal to 3:1.

### User Impact:
Low vision users won't be able to see the selected list item.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NET Core_WPF_DatabindingDemo_ListofProducts_NonTextContrast: The color contrast of the selected list item is less than 3:1." (#6732)
